scenarioDescription:
The BD+15 2940 Exoplanetary System


Overview

BD+15 2940 is a star with 1.1 times the mass of the Sun, and 14.7 times its radius. It is located 1390.79 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

BD+15 2940 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the BD+15 2940 system


BD+15 2940 b

BD+15 2940 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2013-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.54 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of BD+15 2940 b is 352.980 times the mass of Earth. The radius of BD+15 2940 b is 13.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, BD+15 2940 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system BD+15 2940, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the McDonald Observatory.
name: BD+15 2940 - System With 1 Exoplanet
